text: Worst ! Don't have good teacher over there, 3 times change teacher in 1 month. Never accepted complaints from students and parents.

Indigo is recommended to my daughter by her cousin. My daughter attended their trial class and found that the tutor could explain the concepts well. She's satisfied with the class and we will be signing her up.

Do think twice. Bad experience for my case. Sec 2, joined 1+ term, from always been A to C5. When checked with centre, what are they going to do with her grades, how are they going to help and improved. Both tutors could not give any suggestion. Literally went "errr..."".

Most uncomfortable is the way they charged their fees. They even charged on holidays like National days. They do replacement on the same week, but be careful they might not have the same class in the same week. They don't care, charged first, worse is watch recording.

Another is their booster lesson, they don't need your consent or check your availability. They just charged and what happens if you can't make it? Recording lor.

In conclusion, nothing personal, not experience tutor, not engaged, very commercialized centre

I will go for 1 to 1, charges are the same, and you can monitor.  Good luck.
My son has recently just gone for Math trial lesson for JC2. His feedback is good and I signed him up immediately. Hope to see improvement in his result.
In class, the tutors are very nice and understanding. They also explain all the questions clearly and very easy to understand. The class is very fun and enriching.
